GbS99USk8I4s2zQDLrArog.text: I spent 4 months living on Queensway in 2000. My room mate(another yank) and I  ate at this spot at least every other day. When my friends go to England and ask what they should do, they are always surprised when I say  "go to this falafel spot "Taza" on Queensway". Come on people, you can see a clock, old church or big ferris wheel anywhere. but amazing, cheap and unique* food is truly hard to find. Taza is what Robert Langdon was really looking for.*do they still hot press the sandwiches? Ive haven't seen that mentioned in any reviews.A close second to this place is my local spot in New York called "mamouns" and I only speak for the original on Macdougal St. So if your in NYC hit me up and you can buy me one. $3.50

vjEomyIziXWWLa1W_eJDfg.text: 'Taza' is a popular outlet on Queensway. I had walked past a few times over the years but had never gone in because of the large queue of people trailing outside of the shop.Once inside I was surprised at such a small menu. They have Lamb & Chicken Shawarma upright spits and some other vegetarian dishes of Falafel, (but no chips!) Vegetarian Curry and a range of fresh juices.I opted for the Mixed Shawarma and was presented with a large open oval pita with a basic choice of salad and there were chilli & garlic sauces on the counter to which I could help myself!The chicken was fresh, juicy and nicely marinated.The lamb is of a similar good standard though I would put it slightly below 'Best Mangal' or 'Woody Grill' in terms of overall quality & taste.The salad was fresh and more varied than in usual Lebanese shawarma joints.The garlic sauce was fine.The chilli sauce was a mild one but was good and being able to serve myself I put a large amount on to up the spicy heat!The bread was OK but a little soggy - mainly because I put so much hot sauce inside.The service was brusque even on a quiet evening but I put that down to their usual manner of dealing with a crowded house.The mixed shawarma cost £4.A single of either meat in pita will set you back £3.50 and if you want it with rice it is £4.It must be said the prices have stayed the same since I first tried their food in 2009 BUT the portions have gotten noticeably smaller.In conclusion, 'Taza' is worthy of its popularity and the high turnover ensures a quality product at a good price.RECOMMENDED!

bHYcAKdFm8DekZJqgX-dyg.text: Throughout our holiday in London, days usually began or ended passing Taza between our lodging and the closest tube stop (Bayswater).  Nestled amidst the souvenir shops and varied restaurants, Taza caught our eyes when we sought a quick snack, and we were not disappointed.  Despite the multitude of eateries we could have sampled, we intently went to Taza on more than one occasion, because we were so pleased with our initial visit.  On that first visit, my mother, brother, and I shared a mixed shawarma (a mix of chicken and lamb in a round of bread toasted in a press).  Despite the number of mouths sharing the pleasing, crunchy item, we all left well-sated and pleased. We returned and had dinner on a subsequent night, where I had a lamb shawarma, my brother a falafel, and my mother a chicken shawarma, all matching the initial in taste and texture and value. Should I return to London, I know a return to Taza will be inevitable.

ovLAis3a5sJoNu9HdaI8ng.text: Mostly good...but inconsistentOriginally stopped in bc it was one of few places with a queue...and there was a line outside the door. Simpy put, one of the best shawarmas I've eaten to date. After that first sando, I returned daily for the next 4 days and each time was great.And then the 5th visit was so horrific, it completely tainted the previous amazing shawarmas. The lamb was this funky, gristle-laiden mess with a very rotten taste. Curiously enough it was the one visit w/o a queue so apparently everyone else had gotten the memo but me.

Ef4HvfH-6p3H3ATjeal5RA.text: Skip any other place on the street. £3.50 gets you a slammin chicken wrap that gets the job done. The guys there are nice, informative, and quick. One of the best takeouts I've had in London.

IwPLbCLjkZoDRnOykkvGQg.text: Yum, yum, yum! This place is delightfully cheap and filling. Of course if you've had the famous chicken and rice in New York City, it's hard to compare such greatness, but this is quite close to home. It's about the greatest go-to food when one is hungry. Taza has a great white sauce that matches wonderfully with it's rice and meat. My roommates are currently eating a shawarma right now, and I'm getting cravings. It smells delicious, tastes great! I have no complaints about the friendly staff, lovely food and nice prices. The workers are friendly, ready to help you out and always up for a chat. When I think of what I want to eat, Taza is always on the list even if I have more expensive options in mind.

sQ8LwTAFTw9kBFIhX0bLzg.text: I'm always weary of kebab places but this particular one looked clean and was always full of people so i thought, "hey, this must be a yummy place."I went in and ordered the shawarma and boy, was it yummy! The service was fast and very nice. Despite the long lines, the place was efficient and really was a great option for a fast lunch.

GSb1NRVNV-4EKSAey3jONg.text: Don't eat here.  I took one bite, and spent the next three days trying to get the taste of it out of my brain.  I can't even walk past this place any more because the odour makes me nauseous.  I love shawarma, but what was given to me in this place would be turned down by an indian pariah.

LyKW0ZX9pL34jYXi14jYjw.text: The best shwarma and falafels in London. They actually toast the sandwich and have a free hummus/salad mini-bar where you can (i think) eat as much as you want.

yuifaoNZZziBXwDV_qlgXQ.text: Goof falafals, but nothing speacial. Have eaten better ones.

YYdV02tUpjk85q-1rjQYiw.text: THE BEST KEBABS AND SHAWARMAS IN LONDON. PERIOD.There are lines that go out the door daily, but it's well worth it for a shawarma or two. They have an incredible sauce that drips wonderfully into the hands so you can lick your fingers after you're done shoving the sandwich down your pie-hole.Then, there's fresh juices to wash it all down. Oh the memories! I swear the next time I step foot in ol' Blighty, this is the first place I'll stop for a kebab.

DuGLmzux1h7B1BY6OvaomQ.text: Really good lamb shawarma and rice for £4, with all kinds of sauces (tahini, garlic, chilli) on top if that's your fancy. It was very tasty, and I'll go back. Very good indeed for the money, and the lamb wasn't overly fatty and was not processed. It had been cooked in a tasty tangy marinade. There is a tiny 'seating' area at the back where you can sit on a stool or perch at a counter to eat quickly and go. There appears to be a review of the place printed in the Independent newspaper from a couple of years ago framed on the wall, although I didn't get a chance to read it (my food came, I was hungry).

L51OgT058k2nnckXRS43HQ.text: Best shawarma I ever had.  And they offer freshly made juices.  Carrot was good and the melon was fabulous.

FrTQkplEd2U7Eol2QRz8Lg.text: After living in Bayswater for three months, Taza has become part of my and my roommates nightly routine. Possibly the best tasting food in London that I've had yet, as well as the cheapest at 3.50 pounds for schwarma.

BIzNQUfeoKXEEn_Z0Agv6w.text: Always my first meal upon arrival in London. Great shawarma with no frills needed. There is a small seating area but mostly take away.  I like the lamb/chicken combo.

7eCs0a5y7eZ2z3abw-v8DQ.text: I love Taza.  Lamb or chicken?  Lamb or chicken?  How about both!  Not in one sandwich, mind you, but in two.  (Works better with two people but I always feel deprived if I can't at least have a bite of both in any given outing there.)   Delicious.  Sometimes we skip fancy meals out because we haven't had Taza yet.

DGJHJaV6ZSYL7Y9715Lcmg.text: Taza Sandwich... a bit of a yin and yan offering. On one hand, you have a rotating pillar slab of kebab meat, and on the other, wicker baskets of fresh fruit ready to be pureéd for your enjoyment! So they provide everything I could possibly need in one go. A greasy plate of savaged meat to feast upon, and a cool Apple and Mango juice injection to wash it down with. The prices are a little bit expensive but it's a normal correlation the further West you go in London, and you have to understand that they have to pay for the fruit somehow! There are quite a few places in the shop to sit but they are usually taken, and I can't blame them one bit.

VwMVpbb7RAiy4xS9iXk6xw.text: The original take away falaf gaf.  Good chilli sos.  It is a pity they warm up your vegetarian falaf in the same thing they use for the greasy schwarmas.  Nice staff - rough diamonds but good blokes who have been there for years.I wish I owned this business, it must be a real cash cow.

rZHW8krD_ddFP6W4lU0LCQ.text: When I was backpacking Europe, Taza was my go to shop for cheap eats in London. About 3 quid for a lamb or chicken kebab, go with extra spicy sauce. They also have the sauces and cabbage slaw on the side if you need more. Lines can be a little long, which can suck when you have to stand in the rain since the shop is pretty small, but it's damn worth it.

-14AF9q7kPcXp-3NFgL66w.text: Best Lamb-Shawarma in London. Set up for take-away. Almost always a line out the door (but it moves).

Pm0mw5maao3UVFjXHybYqQ.text: Having sampled Taza twice, I can heartily endorse the chicken shawarma and the fresh squeezed orange juice. Don't be put off by the queues, these guys work fast. Everything's made to order so you'll watch your pita being sliced open, the chicken put in and the sandwich being pressed into the grill (which adds an extra dimension - crunch - to the shawarma).Taza's sandwiches are on the small side so if you're fairly hungry you may consider ordering two. And I recommend taking them to go; there are a few seats but they're really cramped.Next time I want to try the mixed shawarma (lamb and chicken).

mzagwHpbpFfmNitSKXwFCQ.text: The shawarma is incredible! Very cramped, but hey, it's London. I strongly recommend it!

BNexvHU6BrNB-fxad7TvTg.text: Excellent chicken shwarma at rock bottom price . Be prepared to wait as there is only 1 grill.

2b9CseUu-iFMCj1PvrdUSA.text: The food was great! Besides my chicken shawarma I think that's what's is called...i ordered a cocktail fruit drink very delicious I enjoyed this place very much service was fast facility was clean and staff was friendly so definitely recommend this place

RPiBagADaMxYY00d0P3qSA.text: The staff is incredibly helpful and the food is amazing! The chicken wrap is incredibly delicious and all that is for a fair price. The chicken and lamb wraps are only £3.50. If you see the queue reaching out of the door, don't be alarmed. The staff works in a tempo that is close to that of almighty fast food gods. A great place for a shawarma to satisfy the late night hunger.Highly recommendable.

yjqy37Zwdbf7y8URr3Q9CA.text: Incredible food. Amazing, friendly service. Great prices. Came here after yelping food in the area open on a Sunday night and this place popped up. Got the vegetarian plate that was recommended and it was so amazingly good. Service was wonderful, the guy was so helpful, fast, attentive and nice and the place is a quant little spot. If it's a busy day or cold out you might now have a place to sit but other than that definitely go!

k9WpwAsXdb1-xy2kSYKQMg.text: This place is GREAT and really fast once you get in the door, there's usually a smallish line but well worth the wait! Go with the Lamb Shawarma and get it with all the sauces they recommend then when you get it, along the wall are big tubs of the best little pepperocinis EVER!!!! And you can get as many as you like plus some really good stuff that's like a finely diced pico de gallo, I always load up on both! They also have sour cream. If you find yourself on Queensway stop in!  You nor your wallet will be disappointed. Cheers!

6Xa2KtPz-DXGXJeFrra2RA.text: Craving a late night snack after a concert at royal albert hall, we stumbled upon Taza based upon yelp reviews. And we were not disappointed. We tried the chicken schwarmas with all the topping, which included various sauces and cabbage. They were tasty, not too spicy. The prices were very reasonable. 3,50£ for one schwarma, which was enough to fill me up.The place itself is small, typical of other hole in the wall places in London. The employees themselves were not too friendly, very dry and wanting to just move you along without explaining much. But this is understandable for a busy place and culture. And in the end, the food was worth it.

ZGkrvoVU93YBZJBcJbdleQ.text: What a great & sweet welcome from the gorgeous young man behind the counter!He made my day by serving me a delicious chicken shawarma with loads of Tahini sauce and pickled peppers.Loved the shawarma and it costs only £3.50 (which is a reasonable price for London) :)

mhbiVxRUsvpyXzkXFBenYw.text: Ordered a lamb shawarma for £3.50 with all the fixings.  It comes in a pita type wrap and is grilled in a panini press first and then loaded with fresh fillings. Good portion of meat and the cabbage slaw added much needed crunch.  Sauce made it a but messy to eat but it was delicious!! Will definitely be back for more

rd_QFrykbQx0e3bMdpVTrw.text: This is hands-down the best meal I've had during my stay in London, and it's practically right around the corner from my hotel. I'm used to NYC style gyros and shawarmas, but this takes it to a whole new level. First of all, they press the lamb and pita on a panini press, so the thing does NOT get soggy or fall apart. Got everything on it and all the flavors combined wonderfully. Also, the line was out the door and checking the reviews here beforehand made me realize quite quickly that I was in for a real treat. I took it to go & devoured it in the comfort of my hotel room. The whole thing may feel small (especially for Americans), but it was the perfect size for me. I don't know if I'll ever be able to go back to ordering a shawarma ever again back home, because Taza is now the standard.

Sh07D3VhBEZKROgBH6vfNw.text: We came here only because food options are limited at 11:30 pm.  Taza closes at midnight on Saturdays thankfully.  We only ordered the lamb shawarma with works which included hot tangy banana peppers, onions, shredded salad, tahini sauce, garlic sauce and hot sauce.  The shawarma is pressed and warmed on a panini grill.  Because we came late, there wasn't much lamb left so we got a lot of burnt ends and bits that weren't very tasty.  I will probably have to try it again but earlier in the day so I can understand why this place gets such great reviews on their shawarmas.  They had a large selection of fresh juices available, but we didn't try any.  Prices are very reasonable, and makes up for it not being the best kebab I've ever eaten.  The guys working behind the counter are really nice.  We were offered free salad since we were going to be one of their last customers for the evening.  This is a great place to come to when nothing else is open and you need to grab a quick cheap bite.

photos.caption: Photo of Taza Sandwich - London, United Kingdom. Open until midnight on Saturdays!

EQ5woTNPbVHQ7iU9T4SsEg.text: While visiting London I noticed long lines outside Taza throughout the day. Usually a good sign so I thought I'd check it out. I had the lamb shawarma which I think was the best meal that I had in London! Highly recommended.

Ekg7IT1q9huwXV-PZArXZw.text: I thought the food was great. Stayed nearby on a recent business trip and stumbled on this little gem while walking around on Queensway. I had a chicken shawarma with everything on it and couple "pieces" of falafel. I'd recommend knowing what you want as I felt like I was in a Seinfeld episode with the ordering queue. The guy running the spit was as unfriendly as they come - I got him out of sorts by apparently asking for a non-standard order. Fortunately I still got my "soup" and wasn't asked to "come back... 1 year". The guy running the register was very friendly though and helped out this Yankee tourist.I'll definitely make an effort to go eat there again if I'm ever back in the area.

r5ZSHuM9VP6VY0s85bxk0Q.text: About 6 years ago I was studying abroad in France but took some time to explore Europe.  My first and last stop was London.  While visiting the area I had no clue where to eat, but I saw this little shop with a line out the door.  I though hmm... There is a good amount of people waiting to eat here so it must be good.  Boy that was the best decision I made.  I still dream of Taza's sandwiches.  I don't think I've had a better shawarma since.  That white sauce with a it of spicy red sauce.... This will be the first stop when I make my way back to London.

qPrlBSqa6JS-ems1pvgt9w.text: Best schawarma on Queensway! Very small inside and each time we passed it, there was a line to order food. Food made as you ordered it ensuring it was made correctly. Cooks all wore gloves, too! Very reasonable priced!

Zik2akOomman8-Pr_-12gg.text: This little hole in the wall sandwich shop has some really tasty shawarma. A local Londoner took me to this hidden gem when I first arrived in London. I had the chicken shawarma with all the fixings (salad, spicy salsa, peppers and their homemade sauce) and some fresh squeezed fruit juices, all for less than a fiver!If you dine in (just a few stools at their back counter) they have salad, salsa, cabbage and peppers on the counter as well so feel free to pile it on even after they've added it to your sandwich.It's a great late night or post pub stop, or even just a good place if you have a hankering for some authentic middle eastern flavor.

ptlTGJQk9fmPaORYOJR7zA.text: In the whole world there is one place that every time I travel to London I have to go. Taza is nothing special for a Joint its just a hole in the wall that really is a hole in the wall. The service leave a bit to be desired but really its part of the experience. The food OMG its like one Sandwich just does not do it. Shwarma's are not hard to make however this is really hard to duplicate. I have tried Shwarma's all over Seattle and nothing not a thing compares.If your ever there you have to go and wait in line and buy two Lamb and Chicken Shwarma's.Taza in Seattle would be good.

8WgDLPBny9a3Zghm78ZQ7A.text: How to identify a successful fast food outlet.1. Nearby competitors serving similar food empty despite long line snaking out of Taza. Check.2. Limited menu showing absolute confidence in your product. Lamb shwarma, chicken shwarma, mixed shwarma, falafel. Period. Mixed fruit juices. Check.3. A small shop with not enough space if I'm being honest. Haven't sold out to corporate chain. Check.4. Open windows onto street offer whaft of amazing smells from the 2 rotating spits. The meat is visibly made up of whole pieces of fresh meat, not an amorphous lump like most kebab shops. Check.5. Finding myself joining the end of a 20 minute queue out  in the cold when I'm in the area. Check.Seriously good kebabs!

6_ISzHbrdYLFQTlvkIUXWw.text: Ate here last night when feeling hungover and tired... and it was pretty darn good! I got a lamb shawarma, which was super crunchy and hot after going into the sandwich press. The meat was plentiful and tasted good (only one bit of gristle) and there was a good amount of salad filler (despite the two counter guys having a bitchy little fight about who was going to get more salad from the back). My only complaint was that it is a bit too spicy for me - next time i'll ask them to hold off on whatever spicy sauce they use. Despite this, i'll definitely be going again.

s34dStGHmnGuacvOnQi06g.text: It was really good but don't forget to bring cash.  I got the Lamb. The meat tasted good.  I wish I had bought 2.

cBg2kkGPIDk2dgOdecakjw.text: Amazing falafel, fresh, delicious. Costumer service was amazing and pretty fast. Got a vegetarian dish egg plant, hummus, falafel, peppers and salad.  Can't wait to get t again.100% recommended

X4fqCGbHbpr2WRLozdlwlg.text: Food was good. Service a bit .. brusque. Always a line. Pricing is good, though. If you're looking for a bite to eat and don't mind being rushed and in a sort of chaotic environment, have at it.

7UtI_E3S4Gww-8dbPJNsjQ.text: Excellent chicken (and lamb) shawarma kebabs for £3.50. I've eaten here four days in a row. Visiting London from L.A. (US) for ten days and I might eat here every one of them.  Yes the owner isn't friendly (to me). No he doesn't take time to be courteous.  But he works like a machine turning ought great food, satisfying lines of customers all day long.Very tasty, very reasonable. Outstanding value.

7uE11vgTyYrFub_BlHPQ1w.text: Awesome kebob and schwaema shop with good food and quick service. Also has a nice variety of fresh juices. Highly recommend!

iCHaJ7um7Ze7z-qFJpdMZA.text: We made it at 10pm and the shop was very hot and small. I asked for meat Sharoma . The meat was full of grease and wasn't tasty. I will not try it again.

ReeOsaN7omyIGcm5j4uYnQ.text: Back again today and never fails me. As soon as you get remotely near this place the smells are wafting your way and you must step inside. You are then oogling the juicy meat watching the drippings glistening. Eat the lamb schwarma!

photos.caption: Photo of Taza Sandwich - London, United Kingdom

bYRDiNbHxICHDFcpQspLZg.text: One of THOSE schwarma sandwich places that leaves you full and wanting more...I think I might be back later today...

8X9KfCxHruhhbSNNEyltbw.text: Best Kebabs in London - Hands down. I love my schwarmas and have tried pretty much every kebab shop down Edgware Road but none of them have been able to beat Taza. It's not the biggest kebab but it's got the right ratio of fillings.It's toasted nicely and goes down a treat with all the friends I take there.

fILF0zpRMYwEIGEV2bGMHg.text: Food tasted chewy and under cooked. The guy behind the counter was yelling at customers on the phone. He had a demeanor that suggested he was "pissed off" I asked him for a large lid twice for our food (take away containers) and he threw two small ones at me. I asked him for a large lid again, he threw another small one at me again. Worst customer service ever. And the food was undercooked. Won't be back. Skip this place.

3cuyiIsh5JIeTgRBOWV5Hg.text: Favorite cheap eat in London!  So tasty.  Service can be a bit short.  Shawarma is the best!  Falafel is good too.

boI_jW74K-NK00EbPVbuOA.text: Very quick and quite tasty. I got the mixed Sharma and my daughter got the lamb Sharma. They were good, but spicier than we typically enjoy and downright soaked in sauce.  Next time...hold the sauce, but we would gladly return!

5JHWfUBMMEcjKUqP_jgM7Q.text: Good for a late night meal -- not much else open around after midnight. The guys at the counter are super friendly and efficient. Not badly priced either.

xNE7Q4HQ8zyOKlaCj9mKrw.text: Excellent place to go on first night in London. If it's close for you, it's a good price and you will not leave hungry. Any of the lamb, chicken or mixed shawarma will do the trick.

8P14lMgmkOytSQRcCkmhXw.text: A budget tourist's dream--delicious, filling, fast, cheap, AND very close to the northwest corner of Hyde Park. In the middle of a street that has a dozen currency exchange shops, too.

uNnZyeeclkppOO8aepVZRQ.text: Tazaaaaa. Oh if only at least half of London places were like this. Quick service no messing around suddenly you have a great wrap with massive salad in your hand and Hyde Park just around the corner. My bf's personal record is 3 Tazas but if you would have to choose one I would recommend either falafel or kofta. Kofta is not always available though. All the wraps are really cheap compare to anywhere around which is another reason why it's always full. Love this place!

H4s5qej-1C4FH5kRZN8eRA.text: Sometimes when I want shawarma, I want to sit down and be waited upon. I want a complimentary plate of olives and pickles, and an order of hummus and pita bread. But then, sometimes, I want the best shawarma in London. And that is what you get at Taza. Eating there is not comfortable. Shawarma is about all they have on the menu that interests me, but I keep coming back from all the way across the city and eating in the park just down the street from Taza if the weather is nice. The chicken is tender and flavorful, the cabbage salad and onions perfectly seasoned, the lavash deliciously grilled. Whatever sauces they use are the right blend of garlicky and spicy. This is the shawarma I dream about when I'm not in London.

7tSKf3S5yd9CTXeow4fXCQ.text: What a jewel hidden in the overly touristy Paddington area! It was open on Christmas day and it's got great reviews from a few Yelpers I know and trust, so we went for a quick lunch. It did not disappoint, the lamb shawarma was seriously amazing... The meat texture and seasoning was just right! They also make freshly squeeze juice in store. I asked for pineapple mixed with apple and that resulted in some very thing fresh and delicious. Strongly recommend this hole-in-the-wall little place if you happened to be in the area.

2AT2vGfLuhqJhYdDwQFimg.text: Stopped in here a couple times for chicken shawarma and lamb kofta kebabs. The flavors were great, though I would have liked a bit more lamb in the wrap. That said, the prices are quite reasonable and the location is great. There is some seating in the restaurant, as well. I did really like having the salad options you can add on your own (onions, sauces, etc).

photos.caption: Photo of Taza Sandwich - London, United Kingdom. Lamb kofta kebab.

t5uZoPP_cm9U9wZnSqZ5_w.text: Goody goody, marvellous.  The kebabs here are tasty. I do drop by now and again and i'd say that it's the quality of the lamb. It's just a simple kebab shop, but the quality is excellent. It's better if you park around the corner and do a quick take away. In that respect they are fast.Very reasonably priced.
